name: Learning To Count
overview: And educational game from William W. Braun, published in both COMPUTE!'s Gazette 1984/09 (Issue #15), and in COMPUTE!'s Commodore Collection - Vol.2. Designed for children in kindergarten througti third grade, this colorjful and fun program lets you tailor the learning level to your child's needs. Educational programs are sometimes broad in scope and appropriate for only one learning level. "Learning To Count" teaches a specific concept and allows the parent or instructor to choose the learning level. Although the game is instructive, colorful graphics, sound, and positive rewards make it entertaining for the child.
